intro: Ouratea schomburgkii, commonly known as the golden mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, rounded clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers that bloom throughout the year. Its leaves are typically opposite, oval-shaped, and have a smooth texture. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its attractive foliage and persistent floral display.
